‎01-25-2010 06:34 AM

Bumping up so those just back on the boards after the weekend see it.

Dianne
Dianne

Diagnosed as type 2 in 2005 with an A1c of 9.1

Started with metformin and a low dose of an ARB for blood pressure. Added a sulfonylurea (a med that helps my pancreas produce my own insulin) Also a low dose of Crestor to lower my cholesterol.
After 7 years I could no longer tolerate metformin so am doing my best to keep control with a max dose of the sulfonylurea and lots of walking, some swimming.

‎01-25-2010 09:37 AM

Please come back soon, Granny Red! We miss you!! Wishing you a speedy recovery, and looking forward to your return (and your "colorful" pictures)..........
Nancy ~ T2 since '98 ~ 17 yrs ~ D&E 11yrs ~ treadmill, elliptical, bike 15-20 minutes 2-3x/day (includes evenings), dumbbells/strength-training, small portions heart-healthy high-fiber/low-fat fuel/carb-counting, modified Mediterranean/semi-vegetarian plant-based diet; 500mg Glucophage XR x4, 5mg Glipizide ER x4, 4000IU Vit. D/day ~ RHR 55 ~ Between 5.9-6.9 A1cs, av. 6.5

Christopher Robin to Pooh Bear

Lee, T2 since 07/1988

An update on GrannyRed

Options
  • Mark as New
  • Bookmark
  • Subscribe to Direct Replies to This Post
  • Subscribe to RSS Feed
  • Highlight
  • Print
  • Email to a Friend
  • Report Inappropriate Content

‎01-26-2010 05:43 AM

Hi Everyone.....I would like to say....THANK YOU ! THANK YOU! THANK YOU! AND THANK YOU! I am feeling much better, Lady G suggested I go to the chiropractor for my headache ( after going to the ER last night and all they did was shoot me up with some great drugs...cool man.......I'm soooooo mellow), so he jumped on my back, gave me a great neck massage and then popped my shoulder back in place....go figure. So now I have some great drugs that I probably won't use and still have just a teeeny tiny bit of a headache.
On another note....I will not be posting a pic of my hip, butt, thigh, knee bruise....I don't want to make you all jealous by posting a pic of my beautiful , long chicken legs with the multicolored bruise. It does look pretty cool....almost as good as Rae's tattoo. Too bad it isn't summer here, I could make up a great story to tell down at the beach ....." I was paddling out and was just about ready to catch a really cool set when all of a sudden a shark nudged my board and took a bite....I had to wrassle my board from him and then kicked the sh$$ out of him to let go......" . Oh well.....surfing a stream in a bad rain storm will have to be good enough. I hope this finds you all doing well......See Ya........Big Red...Peace
Granny Red is Big Red Type 2 DX 2/17/09 A1c 7.7 2/2011 A1c 4.7  5/2011 A1c  4.7 8/2011 A1c 4.9 -11/2011 -4.7
March / 2012 New A1c 5.0 !
A1c Nov.2012...4.7
A1c Jan 21, 2013 5.2 Adding Met 2 X 500 mg
Newest A1c April 24,2013....back to 4.9......WOOOOOHOOOO!!!!
Low Carb and lots of Exercise Don't believe everything you think !!!!!! Please help save the Earth.....it's the only planet with Chocolate !!!!
NATIVE EARTH !!!!!
My Secret..............low carb, exercise, Graze not Gorge and portion size !!!!!!

Information is not knowledge; knowledge is not wisdom; wisdom is not truth. Truth must be absolute; otherwise it is merely opinion.
